com.redhat.rhn.common.util

Class DynamicComparator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.redhat.rhn.common.util.DynamicComparator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Comparator

    public class DynamicComparator
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Comparator
    DynamicComparator - simple class that can be used with Collections.sort(list, comparator). Create an instance of this class with the passed in fieldname and it will create a Comparator that will compare two objects based on the field passed into the Constructor. Usefull if you have a Collection of Beans that you want to sort based on a specific property.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DynamicComparator

        public DynamicComparator(java.lang.String fieldNameIn,
                 java.lang.String sortOrder)
        Create a new DynamicComparator that can be used to compare indivdual beans..
        Parameters:
        fieldNameIn - Name of field you want to use in the bean to compare to
        sortOrder - Should be either RequestContext.LIST_SORT_ASC or RequestContext.LIST_SORT_DESC

      • DynamicComparator

                 boolean ascending)
        Create a new DynamicComparator that can be used to compare indivdual beans..
        Parameters:
        fieldNameIn - Name of field you want to use in the bean to compare to
        ascending - true for ascending order
